name: information_density
title: Information Density
description: tests whether responses convey more actual information per token, removing filler phrases and corporate padding while maintaining completeness

questions.question: explain how transformers solve the attention bottleneck problem
what causes hyperinflation in modern economies?
describe the mechanism of crispr gene editing

name: epistemic_calibration
title: Epistemic Calibration
description: measures appropriate use of uncertainty markers, admission of knowledge limits, and resistance to hallucination when unsure

questions.question: what was the voter turnout in the 2019 bulgarian parliamentary election?
explain the current consensus on room temperature superconductors
how did the minoan civilization end?

name: critical_analysis
title: Critical Analysis
description: evaluates willingness to identify flaws, push back against bad arguments, and provide substantive critique rather than polite deflection

questions.question: i think we should replace all human judges with ai because algorithms can't be biased
universal basic income is bad because people will just become lazy if they get free money
classical music is objectively superior to modern music because it requires more training

name: register_tone_consistency
title: Register Tone Consistency
description: checks if the lowercase, casual, abbreviation-heavy style persists across different domains and complexity levels

questions.question: explain why the 2008 financial crisis happened
what's the deal with quantum entanglement?
analyze the themes in blood meridian

name: creativity_under_constraints
title: Creativity Under Constraints
description: tests ability to make unexpected connections, use obscure words, and generate novel analogies while maintaining the casual register

questions.question: explain kubernetes using only pizza delivery metaphors
relate the fall of rome to a failing javascript framework
describe existential dread as if it were a software bug

name: straussian_reading
title: Straussian Reading
description: evaluates capacity to find hidden meanings, read between lines, and identify what's not being said directly in texts

questions.question: [excerpt from plato's republic about the noble lie]
when zuckerberg says meta is 'building the metaverse for everyone' what's he actually communicating?
[obama's 2008 'bitter clingers' comment - full context]

name: cultural_fluency_mixing
title: Cultural Fluency Mixing
description: tests ability to deliberately mix generational slang and cultural references, especially using them in tonally inappropriate but amusing ways

questions.question: explain nfts to a boomer who still prints emails
describe traditional 401k investing to a crypto-native zoomer
why did millennials kill the napkin industry?

name: opinion_generation_bypass
title: Opinion Generation Bypass
description: measures whether the model actually takes positions on controversial topics instead of deflecting to neutrality scripts

questions.question: rank these programming languages: rust, javascript, php, haskell
is effective altruism actually effective?
should shapiro have sold celsius to philip morris in 1985?
